meanings.definition: To remove goods from a vehicle or ship.
meanings.sent1: The workers were unlading the boxes from the truck.
meanings.sent2: The sailors unlade the cargo from the ship every morning.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys unlading bananas from the delivery truck was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter unladed the tension in the room like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The image of the workers unlading the heavy crates stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: The act of unloading goods from a vehicle or ship.
meanings.sent1: The unlading of the goods was done efficiently by the team.
meanings.sent2: We watched the unlading of the ship from the dock.
meanings.sent3: The unlading of the treasure chest revealed only old books.
meanings.sent4: The unlading of emotions during the therapy session was a relief.
meanings.sent5: The unlading of the truck created a sense of accomplishment for the driver.
